events.name: Mindef Internet of Things (IoT) Challenge - IBM Workshop
events.description: Digital Transformation on the digital Innovation Platform Bluemix. In this digital era, uberization is making many big organizations start learning from new digital startups bringing digital innovation as part of the company’s roadmap. Big data, Cloud, Mobile, IoT, Cognitive and UXUI are buzz words for organizations including airlines to rethink and outthink. Bluemix enables everyone from individual developers to large enterprise teams to rapidly build and deploy new applications, embrace continuous delivery and extend existing IT investments with cloud integration services. With Bluemix, developers have access to a broad portfolio of capabilities -- IBM, open source, and 3rd party services - across DevOps, Big Data, Mobile, IoT, Blockchain, Analytics, Cognitive and Security on Cloud with a click of a button. IBM Bluemix Services that will be discussed: - Watson (Cognitive) - Internet of Things(IoT) - Data Analytics - Mobile - Blockchain Come and learn, share and prepare for Mindef Internet of Things (IoT) Challenge. Selected participants from the workshop will be eligible for further mentorship which includes design thinking and quick prototyping.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: GRAB x DSSG (Product Team Management & Internal Map Service)
events.description: Hi all,For our August meetup, we're excited to have Michael Ke Zhang, Data Product Manager at Grab who will share on the intricacies of managing a Data Product Team as well as experiences on building Grab’s internal map service. RSVPs will open on Friday, 19th August (12pm) and close on 23rd August (12am). Housekeeping• Please refer to the new attendance policy before RSVP to this meetup.• RSVP will only open on 19th August, Friday (12pm) and closes on 22nd August, Tuesday (7pm). Event details6.45pm - 7.15pm: Networking session [casual; small talk]  7.15pm - 8.45pm [core level]:  Talk SummaryHow does a data product come to life in a tech company like Grab? How does a company decide what data product to build, what data to collect, what technologies to use, and how to organize a cross-functional team to build it? In this talk, Michael, a data product manager at Grab, will give a presentation about these topics.Specifically, he will talk about how Grab utilized the largest traffic data collected in Southeast Asia to construct their internal map service, GrabRoad. Recently launched in Indonesia, GrabRoad has surpassed the Google Map’s accuracy in Indonesia and saved millions of dollars. 8.45pm - 9pm: Networking session [casual; small talk][] : Suggested rating and topic; ranges from:newbie - casual - core - hardcore. About our speaker: Michael Ke Zhang graduated from Stanford University in 2012 with a Ph.D in Applied Physics, where he applied statistical methods to learn the folding dynamics of DNA hairpins. He has ever since then worked in startups (as a founder, a product manager, a software engineer, and to a less degree, a data scientist). He’s now working at Grab as a data product manager, where he found his multidiscipline background to be very useful. His passion is to create technologies to empower people. LinkindIn Profile: www.linkedin.com/in/michaelkezhang
events.location: PayPal, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985, Singapore

events.name: Book Club: Algorithms on Strings – Week 4
events.description: Algorithms on Strings on Coursera   Come and learn with a group of us working through this online course together. This Week: Algorithmic Challenges (Week 3) * Finish Assignment 3: Algorithmic Challenges Description World and internet is full of textual information. We search for information using textual queries, we read websites, books, e-mails. All those are strings from the point of view of computer science. To make sense of all that information and make search efficient, search engines use many string algorithms. Moreover, the emerging field of personalized medicine uses many search algorithms to find disease-causing mutations in the human genome. See https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-on-strings for more info on this course. Coursera offers a free "auditor" option and a paid option, if you want a certificate at the end. How to Participate 1. Watch the lectures and start the week's assignments.2. Find something in the week's content you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting or ask questions.4. Group discussion and friendly banter ensues! All are welcome – beginners, experts, students and professionals. Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore 437032 Doors open at 7:00, meetup starts at 7:20.Bring healthy snacks and drinks of your choice! Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS Bookclub Gitter channel: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions/bookclub <a href="https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-on-graphs/home/week/2"></a>
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Viz.sg launch party & first monthly HHSG talk
events.description: It's been awhile but to kick things off for our first monthly meetup, we'll be presenting Viz.sg, a portal for all things data viz in Singapore. We'll have a few quick talks too! Chi-loong Chan, founder, VslashR - Singaporean data viz firmData & UX: How to use two trending tools to tell better stories Rebecca Pazos, Interactive graphics journalist, The Straits TimesHow we took one chart and turned it into an interactive feature ------------------ Keep a space for the fourth Tuesday of every month if you're interested in hearing about data journalism and how it's being done in Singapore. If you're working on some cool data viz or web development project involving journalism - we'd love to invite you to chat about your work! ------------------
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989
